title: You aren't the Challenger God you think you are, please calm down with the Ezreal and Lee Sin picks.

replies.body: Maybe just let people play champions they want to play because they think they're fun.

> [{quoted}](name=Flaherty,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6m3EkHj7,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-12-24T02:07:50.905+0000)
>
> Maybe just let people play champions they want to play because they think they're fun.

The problem is when they play those champions on ranked games.

Sure, you can play what you want on ranked, but make sure you pratice that on normal games first.
Okay? That goes without saying for literally every champion

Tell that to the people who first time pick an unplayed champion into a ranked game, or worse: the dreaded new release/rework champion straight into ranked, on the assumption they are 'OP' and therefore 'freelo.'
they play these champs cause they are broken not cause they are fun. When they are in line the play rate balances out.
I didn't realize you could experience every other person's perspective and know for a fact no one finds those champions fun to play

Sigh your reading comprehension must be bad.

I would like you to explain the fact when Lee and others are in line there play rates drop significantly. Yes there are people that play him still when this happens those are the ones playing for enjoyment.

Everyone else that is now playing cause he is "fun" while strong are not playing cause the champ is "fun". Instead they find winning fun and they are willing to play what gets them the win. 

Stop acting like this is a complicated case. It is case of simple numbers. 

I need to get sig for people... it should say "you are not that deep or special"

It's really not, but keep making comments like that to give yourself that false sense of superiority you so desperately need to feel like you have some value.  Give me these number you refer to as fact, show me the actual percentages of the play rate decreases when the champions are not in "overpowered" states and then we'll see if those changes are statistically significant.

good job deflecting at your inability to keep up

i made some fairly basic statements, if that is overwhelming you i am sry.
